content.description: predicting the outcome of a piece of code (2016 Fall, Midterm 1, Question 7)

p.line: There are some helper blocks for control and sensing of a robot, starting in the bottom center of the grid, facing up.
When calling _CODES_move forward (INPUT)_CODEE_, the robote moves _EMPHS_INPUT_EMPHE_ squares forward in the direction it is facing.
When calling _CODES_rotate left_CODEE_ or _CODES_rotate right_CODEE_, the robote turns 90 degrees counterclockwise and clockwise respectively. _CODES_turn around_CODEE_ would result in a u-turn.

_CODES_can move {left, forward, right}_CODEE_ would check if there is a free square to the robot's {left, forward, right} to move onto, if yes, return _EMPHS_true_EMPHE_, else return _EMPHS_false_EMPHE_.
Among A, B, C, D, E and F, how many letters would be reached if we run the script?

content.hint: A, C. go straight, turn left, turn left, and cycle on A and C forever.
